pullRequest.title: Issue #7562: Add default config example for ClassTypeParameterName
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #7562

$ cat config.xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC
        "-//Puppy Crawl//DTD Check Configuration 1.3//EN"
        "http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/dtds/configuration_1_3.dtd">
<module name="Checker">
    <module name="TreeWalker">
       <module name="ClassTypeParameterName">
       </module>
    </module>
</module>

$ cat Test.java
class MyClass1<T> {}   // OK
class MyClass2<t> {}   // violation

$ java -jar checkstyle-8.36.2-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java
Starting audit...
[ERROR] D:\OpenSource\TestCommit\Test.java:2:16: Name 't' must match pattern '^[A-Z]$'. [ClassTypeParameterName]
Audit done.
Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.

beforeCommit.message: Issue #7562: Add default config example for ClassTypeParameterName

afterCommit.message: Issue #7562: Add default config example for ClassTypeParameterName

nodes.bodyText:
use format from

  
    
      checkstyle/src/main/resources/google_checks.xml
    
    
        Lines 212 to 216
      in
      e7277f7
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <module name="ClassTypeParameterName"> 
        

        
          
             <property name="format" value="(^[A-Z][0-9]?)$|([A-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]*[T]$)"/> 
        

        
          
             <message key="name.invalidPattern" 
        

        
          
                    value="Class type name ''{0}'' must match pattern ''{1}''."/> 
        

        
          
           </module>
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -39,22 +39,45 @@ * 
  * <module name="ClassTypeParameterName"/>
  *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass1<T> {}        // OK
+ * class MyClass2<t> {}        // violation
+ * class MyClass3<abc> {}      // violation
+ * class MyClass4<LISTENER> {} // violation
+ * class MyClass5<RequestT> {} // violation
+ *
+ *

+ * To configure the check for names that are uppercase word: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="ClassTypeParameterName">
+ *   <property name="format" value="^[A-Z]{2,}$"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass1<T> {}        // violation
+ * class MyClass2<t> {}        // violation
+ * class MyClass3<abc> {}      // violation
+ * class MyClass4<LISTENER> {} // OK
+ * class MyClass5<RequestT> {} // violation
+ *
*

- * An example of how to configure the check for names that are only a single - * letter is: + * To configure the check for names that are camel case word with T as suffix: *

- *

Configuration:

* 
  * <module name="ClassTypeParameterName">
- *   <property name="format" value="^[a-zA-Z]$"/>
+ *   <property name="format" value="^[A-Z][a-zA-Z]+T$"/>

@@ -39,22 +39,45 @@ * 
  * <module name="ClassTypeParameterName"/>
  *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass1<T> {}        // OK
+ * class MyClass2<t> {}        // violation
+ * class MyClass3<abc> {}      // violation
+ * class MyClass4<LISTENER> {} // violation
+ * class MyClass5<RequestT> {} // violation
+ *
+ *

+ * To configure the check for names that are uppercase word: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="ClassTypeParameterName">
+ *   <property name="format" value="^[A-Z]{2,}$"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass1<T> {}        // violation
+ * class MyClass2<t> {}        // violation
+ * class MyClass3<abc> {}      // violation
+ * class MyClass4<LISTENER> {} // OK
+ * class MyClass5<RequestT> {} // violation
+ *
*

- * An example of how to configure the check for names that are only a single - * letter is: + * To configure the check for names that are camel case word with T as suffix:
